name: Roasted Salmon Tacos
headline: Roasted Salmon Tacos
recipeIngredient: 3/4 pound green cabbage, cored and finely shredded
1/2 seedless cucumber, unpeeled, halved lengthwise, seeds removed and very thinly sliced
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
Olive oil, for greasing the pan
1 3/4 pounds center-cut fresh salmon fillet, skin removed
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
3 tablespoons freshly squeezed lime juice, divided
4 ripe Hass avocados, seeded and peeled

recipeInstructions.text: At least an hour before you plan to serve the tacos, toss the cabbage, cucumber, vinegar, dill, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper together in a large bowl. Cover and refrigerate, allowing the cabbage to marinate.

When ready to serve, preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Brush a baking dish with olive oil and place the salmon in it. Mix the chile powder, lime zest, and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt in a small bowl. Brush the salmon with 1 tablespoon of the lime juice and sprinkle with the chipotle seasoning mixture. Roast for 12 to 15 minutes, depending on the thickness of the fish, until the salmon is just cooked through.

Wrap the tortillas in 2 foil packets and place them in the oven with the salmon. Roughly mash the avocados with the remaining 2 tablespoons of lime juice, the Sriracha, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper.

To serve, lay 2 warm tortillas on each of 6 plates. Place a dollop of the avocado mixture on one side of each tortilla, then some large chunks of salmon, and finally, some of the slaw. Fold the tortillas in half over the filling (they will be messy!) and serve warm.

review.reviewBody:
Delicious, easy to prepare and definitely will serve again.
Ina never disappoints. I am a real fan!
A definite winner. Great flavor. I used flour tortillas instead of corn and regular chile powder since I didn’t have chipotle. We’ll definitely make this again.
Very tasty! Marinated fish with ingredients and grilled. Will be serving again!
This was so delicious! Hubby loved it so much that it’s a do over for sure! Thank you for sharing!
We a
This was a keeper  recipe.  I just love it.

A nice twist to a taco. We served them to 22 people at our beach house and everyone loved them. We served with rice with chopped zucchini onions tomatoes black beans and pigeon peas and cooked the rice w/chicken broth and that was a big hit too. Kind of like a Mexican fried rice :-)
These are  hit in our house!  Easy, healthy, and delicious.

For those who thought it was too salty, you probably used regular salt instead of kosher salt. Kosher salt is about half as "salty" tasting as table salt, especially the kind she, and many chefs, use. So cut it in half and see how that works for you.
Great and E-Z

I’ve made this before and loved it. I made it tonight for some family members who are working on eating healthier meals. They were shocked at how tasty and filling the tacos were without cheese or sour cream. I did use flour tortillas at insistence of one person -warmed on griddle.
These are WONDERFUL! Followed directions except used flour tortillas. I like corn tortillas but they don’t hold up well when heated (at least for me).  Will make these over and over!

Delicious, easy and special. Followed the recipe as written. There was no salt problem as mentioned in other reviews. The rich salmon against the crisp, tangy slaw and spicy avocado was the bomb. I also served the tacos with a crema drizzle because that’s what I like. Ina is a goddess.
My family and I really liked this recipe, but found the lime a little too overpowering. I'll make again with half the lime on the fish and in the avocado mix.
YUMMY!!  So easy to follow and it turned out so delicious!! <3   I love you INA!!!
Soooo good!  The crema and the slaw were fantastic!  A keeper for sure.
One of our favorite meals! We have made this for dinner parties to rave reviews. Also very healthy ingredients. Very low fat and calories.
Delicious and easy, thanks Ina. I had purple cabbage and no cucumber and the slaw was still tasty!
This is a very tasty recipe, that was a nice way to celebrate my birthday eve!
Delicious ! Quick and easy

This is a wonderful dinner for any night of the week...quick to prepare and no heavy fish smell in the house since it’s baked. Always trying to get more fish in the regular rotation at my house for health reasons and hubby loves it. Another Ina winner!
We loved this - simple, fresh, a little bit of heat...fantastic!
These were YUMMY!  So much flavor in that salmon!  Nice level of heat.  The "guacamole" to go along was also delicious.  Thanks for another winner, Ina!
Another winner from Ina! These tacos are so delicious and flavorful!
Very good, I really enjoyed the light slaw.
My favorite
Very flavorful! And a good spin on fish tacos.  The slaw was cool and refreshing while the gauc added some much needed creaminess to the salmon which had good spice. Thanks for sharing!
I’ve never given Ina a “three star”  review, but these tacos just didn’t do it for me.  I think the chipotle (which I like), overpowered the salmon...and I even cut it way back.  Oh well.
My fav “go to” fish taco recipe - whole family loves it!  I just use sliced avocado in place of guac.
This recipe was delicious! Most of all it was so easy.
The whole family can eat this recipe. We pair it with Ina’s corn and basil salad on the side. Healthy and delicious!
This recipe is so good. I added brown sugar to the salmon rub the second time I made them and it was incredible. Highly recommend!
This is the best fish tacos I ever had.   The whole family love it.  Will do it again
My entire family loved this. The mix of tastes and textures was amazing! Will definitely make again!
This is AMAZING!!!!! Quick and delicious is good enough for entertaining and as a quick weeknight meal. Highly recommend it.
Wow I’m not a big avocado person but with sriracha, salt and lime. Wonderful!!!
DELISH!!!
My family eats a lot of salmon and we’re always looking for new ways to prepare it.  This is a big winner.  It’s so tasty and the combination of flavors is incredible.  Another great recipe from Ina!
Delicious and easy. Not boring, plain old salmon. Coleslaw has just a few ingredients. Will make again!
So easy.  I never thought of making such a simple slaw which made the tacos. Absolute num!
Excellent!  Very balanced flavors
This is the best meal known to man. Not kidding right now!

So few ingredients produced so much flavor!  The salmon was tremendous and would be good as a standalone salmon dish.  The guacamole was delicious.  My only criticism is with the coleslaw.  It was ok as a taco topper on the day it was made.  However, after standing overnight, the slaw became increasingly tart and overpowering.
These are easy to make and pack a punch of flavor. Highly recommend.
These are so simple and so delicious. I would suggest serving them in the late afternoon on a covered porch with family, friends and frozen margaritas.
These are so yummy and healthy for you too! I could eat this every week!

I made these tacos tonight and they were AMAZING! The only change that I made is that I reduced the salt in the chipotle rub to one teaspoon.  (I also used wild king salmon. )    I loved the flavor of the rub, the fact that the fish was roasted not fried, and the slaw was the bomb!  I plan to use some of the fish for lunch tomorrow over baby arugula with a Greek yogurt and fresh herb dressing. Yummy
Amazing!
So good
Would have been amazing without so much salt. The joke at our table: Kids, sit down, your mom worked hard on her salt dish.
Delish!!!! And super easy!!!

So delicious & easy to make. You are right, salmon & lime go together so well.  For guacamole, I added one clove of garlic chopped & a sliver of jalapeño chopped for more heat, and oh, boy it was full of zest !! Made it three times already.   Great way to eat Salmon
Absolutely spectacular. The flavors work so well together! Will definitely make again and again.

This was delicious. I didn't have chipotle chile powder, so I used New Mexico chile powder. And used lime juice instead of vinegar on the slaw. It was really good. I love the fact that this is baked and not fried. It's healthier and less messy in the kitchen. Will definitely make again!
We could not stop eating it! So good
This was pretty easy and excellent.  We loved everything but the slaw was fantastic!
I think this will be a weekly standard with us. As with all recipes you can tweak it to your special tastes but for me it was great just the way it is. Thanks, Ina. I love your shows.
Can't wait do this very soon. Will keep everyone posted.
Love it!! We make this all the time!! So quick and easy!

I am going to give this a try using baby romaine leaves to replace the tortillas to make it low carb. I will also tweak the slaw by adding thinly sliced red onion and replacing the dill with cilantro. I think the smashed avocado will go well with all the components.
Awesome. Have made so many times. Love it
Good ingredients but the flavors just don’t work together. I eat a lot of tacos and I didn’t care much for it.

Much as I love Ina, my butcher says it is next to impossible to skin the salmon prior to cooking .. she did not really address this.  So, I will make it , skin on, and know it will still taste fabulous ... wish she would add a note to this comment about the skin.  Thanks, Ina.

Made this for guests last night and was so delicious both guys ate five tacos each. Didn’t have sriracha, used cholula for the guacamole and was still so yummy. Cut the heat of the chipotle and used smoked pap and chili powder in case guests wouldn’t like it too spicy.  Also bought a bag of pre shredded slaw to save some time. Grocery store had amazing looking wild salmon, I flaked it up and set the tortillas next to it for serving. I have made before exactly as is and equally great. Amazing, can’t wait to make this again.

Excellent summer dinner. Guest worthy.  I agree, even for people that think they don't like salmon and/or avocado, this is a home run!I used my own favorite cole slaw recipe, made the day before. Easy and fast, and I even baked the salmon on  the pan in the toaster oven (1lb for two with leftovers) with the foil wrapped tortillas alongside to warm, so no hot kitchen! I substituted regular chili powder (which already has salt in it, so you can use less salt), and followed the directions and it was divine. Jalapeño chips with salsa and Corona while you wait!
These are so flavorful and delicious! Nobody makes salmon like Ina does.   I’m cutting calories after having my baby and these are a healthy alternative to a traditional taco night.
Delicious healthy and easy recipe that can be made with many variants. I make more slaw and put no salt on fish or avocado. It is delicious.
Even better than I thought it would be, and I thought it would be good... undercook the salmon!! I used sweet and smoked paprika instead of chipotle because I didn’t have it and it was great.

This recipe has become one of our favorites.  Similar to other reviews, I cut back on the salt on the salmon.  Ina calls for 1 1/2 teaspoons; I use just a 1/2.  And I cut the salt in half for the avocado mixture.  Incredible flavors!
Delicious! Restaurant-quality tacos at home! I definitely recommend this recipe.

These were really good. Hubby and I recently decided to try to start eating better and came across these. Neither of us like Avocado but we tried it anyway. The only change we made was to use lettuce wraps instead of tortillas. Still VERY good. :D

Watch Ina make this on our DVR, we save most of foodnet works programs. I told my hubby "OH MY" we have got to try this. Went to our local butcher and ordered some fresh salmon, picked it up the next day and in the oven it went.  l like others do not do hot well so i just add a different spice to my salmon. 
Followed everything else to a tee. This dish was so good. I love to eat clean and this exactly delivered. So easy to make and a TIME saver. Love that too!! Thank you Ian.
i was skeptical because i've never had salmon tacos, or seen them on a menu for that matter. but these are awesome! try them!

This was one of the most delicious recipes I have ever made!  First of all, the roasted salmon was so flavorful and perfected cooked.  The avocado and slaw were the perfect accompaniment to the salmon.  My husband who is not a huge fan of avocado just loved the taco.  I used whole wheat tortillas.  Highly recommend!

These were amazing! I made a single portion by just shrinking everything and eyeballing it, and everything worked just fine. I didn't bother to mix the seasonings but instead sprinkled them on the salmon so I could control the amount for my individual serving. I also left out the sriracha. I may not bother taking the skin off next time, it was a pain. :) Looking forward to making these regularly! Thanks Ina, you never disappoint!
So delicious! Even my picky eight year old loved these. A regular part of our dinner rotation now.

Amazing!  One of our go to weeknight recipes.  I think I've made them at least four times now.  Love that I can just pop the salmon in the oven and forget about it.  Cabbage slaw is super quick to throw together --have even done it the morning before work and it's perfect by dinner.  Avocado mixes up quickly while the salmon and tortillas are in the oven.  Full of flavor and hit every time!  Thanks for another awesome recipe, Ina!
I'd so make these again! Really quick, easy, healthy and delicious. A win all around!
Delish
Insanely delicious! Family of four (Mom, Dad, 12 yr old and 8 yr old) - and we devoured these tonight.

So delicious and easy to make!! Next time I prepare this dish, I plan to use less salt -- perhaps my fillet was smaller than in the recipe, but my family found it to be too salty. Also the chipotle chili powder is actually quite spicy on its own, but the slaw and guacamole cut away at the heat -- if you have little ones at home like I do, you might want to reconsider the amount of chipotle powder you use. Lastly, I plan to make my own corn tortillas next time with maza -- that would have really elevated the dish.  All in all, I give this recipe an A+!
Easy to make and who doesn't like tacos? Everything goes really well together so make sure you follow the recipe exactly. The slaw with the tacos adds a fresh twist.
The salmon was great.   I added cumin, smoked paprika, and cut back on the chipotle pepper.  I would also cut back on the amount of salt on the salmon.
Adding this into our monthly meal rotation. It was delicious!

Great recipe.   This was easy, refreshing, and great taste.  The salmon came out flakey and the spices were great. The cabbage and cucumber slaw was a welcome change from iceberg lettuce and cheddar cheese. The avocado mash with the sriracha had just the right combination of heat. I served it with black beans.   Will be a staple at our house.

These salmon tacos were amazing.  The salmon was moist and tender, and the slaw was a good addition.  And of course who could say no to avocados? So simple, so easy, so yummy - we'll definitely be making this again!  Delicious!
Oh. My. Lord. How do you know a recipe is good? When ALL the kids have seconds. So simple, so delicious, so popular!!!
We loved these tacos!  Just the right amount of heat and the slaw was cool and fresh.  Loads of flavor AND a healthy meal that was fast and simple.  It's a keeper!

video.name: Roasted Salmon Tacos
video.description: Dill slaw and mashed avocado adds crunch and a touch of heat to Ina's weeknight tacos.
